title: Shipton Gorge Walks

images.title: Maurice D Budden / Shipton Hill
images.caption: Shipton Hill. On the hill is evidence of a prehistoric settlement

images.title: Nigel Mykura / Summit of Shipton Hill
images.caption: Summit of Shipton Hill. View NW with the trig point in the foreground and the strip lynchets at Loders in the distance.

images.title: Mick Finn, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: View south from Brook Street, Shipton Gorge, Dorset across cottage gardens to St Martin's parish church

images.title: Chris Eaton / Farmland near Shipton Gorge
images.caption: Farmland near Shipton Gorge

images.title: Nigel Mykura / View North From Shipton Hill
images.caption: View North From Shipton Hill. The hill is one of the highest and most prominent hills in the area visible from a considerable distance. In the middle is the unnamed copse above Uploders Farm and beyond are the strip lynchets between Loders and Uploders.

images.title: Mike Faherty / Shipton Gorge, St. Martin's Church
images.caption: St. Martin's Church. The church sits on a hill overlooking the main street with some splendid views across the countryside from its elevated position. The noteworthy building includes an early 15th century tower and a 13th century font.

description: This small village is located just east of Bridport in the county of Dorset. The pretty settlement is surrounded by some lovely rolling countryside and is close to the wonderful Jurassic Coast at Burton Bradstock. There's also a historic 15th century church, picturesque thatched cottages and a fine local pub for refreshments after your walk. This circular walk from the village takes you up to Shipton Hill. The hill stands at a height of 170 metres and lies just to the north east of the village. You can follow a mixture of quiet country lanes and public footpaths up to the hill summit where you'll find a trig point and some pleasant views over the surrounding countryside.
